p: A. aegypti and more particularly A. polynesiensis may be efficient vectors of RRV in FP. Vector competence for RRV has been demonstrated for several populations of these two species, including an FP population of A. polynesiensis [26], [30], [33]. An additional argument for A. aegypti and A. polynesiensis to have sustained RRV transmission in FP is the observation that among all FP archipelagos, RRV antibody prevalence was higher for the inhabitants of Austral-Gambier and Marquesas Islands [34], despite C. annulirostris never having been indexed in the latter archipelago [27].
